title: hZti
author: hZti
content: On the 2nd November ten years ago I registered on bitcointalk. I was fascinated about the idea of decentralization and that everyone could be a part of the network. At that time I was just 16 years old and liked bitcointalk on the one hand because there was an incredible amount of meme shitposts and giveaways (bitcoin giveaways and not shitcoin drops like today), but on the other hand I was fascinated that random strangers on the internet would basically answer every question that could potentially arise about bitcoin. Over the years bitcointalk has change a bit and has grown into a more professional platform, even if at the same time it has lost some very great minds (and found some). My wish for the next ten years would be that we can keep this platform as it is and at the same time are able to preserve all this knowledge that was stored here for the last years (since for now it mostly depends on active, well educated users answering questions).My wish for bitcoin however is that we can have as much adoption as possible since even if not everyone thinks the same, for me this is the most important step for the long term success of a decentralized payment system.

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: Happy 10th anniversary on Bitcointalk! You are lucky one who succefully completed ten years here. This is great achievement, achieved by very few peoples. Many people created account in 2013 but couldn't continue to be active. Indeed you got this forum very early and gives valuable time. It's fascinating to see the growth and changes in the these ten years from meme and one line post to more professional, helpful posts with full share of knowledge. We expect something more professional in the next decade. Many members are using their potential to make this forum most accurate, useful, knowledgeable which is backbone of this forum. we are hoping for continuous growth and wider acceptance of decentralized payment systems in the future.
